ygData.subject: Re: Banded Prices
ygData.msgSnippet: To Jason: Why is a 15pp profit too steep?  They could pay 15pp for a ringmail tunic and get less ac and more weight or pay 90pp for a chain tunic for the same
ygData.messageBody:
To Jason: Why is a 15pp profit too steep? They could pay 15pp for a
ringmail tunic and get less ac and more weight or pay 90pp for a chain tunic
for the same results or wait for bronze. It's not a matter of how much I
make, it is a matter of how much they are willing to pay.

Ok, 40pp is a tad steep. There is a certain line people have to draw. If
people charged 40pp for a tunic, they'd probably charge 300pp for a suit.
You can make your own suit for less than that. It takes 150pp to get to a
reasonable master skill (early 100's) and another 60 to craft your own set.
This would take time, but, saving money is worth it and they can also sell
their own banded afterwards.

People will never (not even on a new server) pay chain prices for banded
because if they had the money to do that, they could make their own banded
or go to unrest and pick up ring/bronze.

Trenfen of Fennin Ro



----- Original Message -----
From: Paul Heenan <pheenan@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 2:50 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banded Prices


> From: Paul Heenan <pheenan@...>
>
> Wait a minute. Banded mail is worth way more than Chainmail, hands down.
> Lighter in weight and better AC at the same time. This again proves the
fact
> that the prices should be a heck of a lot more than what they are. Why is
> 40pp not a reasonable price for a Banded Tunic? Chainmail Tunics are 98pp
in
> the shops! So you're telling me that a piece of armor that gives better
> stats all around isn't even worth half the money?! I will never sell a
> banded tunic for under 20pp, it's just no worth it.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Chris Lin [SMTP:chrislin@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 12:35 PM
> > To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banded Prices
> >
> > From: "Chris Lin" <chrislin@...>
> >
> > Anything above 20 plat is a ripoff? I wouldn't say it's a ripoff, but
> > given
> > the current market status, it is high. The only ripoff would be if we
> > were
> > selling much higher than chain prices, which we never will. 20pp for a
> > tunic is prefectly resonable.
> >
> > Trenfen of Fennin Ro
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
> > To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
> > Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 10:50 AM
> > Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banded Prices
> >
> >
> > > From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
> > >
> > > ore...free
> > > mold...few gold
> > > water...few silver
> > >
> > > cost of materials is only a couple of plat, so for someone to sell a
few
> > gold above cost, the tunic would have to be no more than about 5
> > plat....i've never seen anybody selling that cheap. 10plat a tunic is
> > still
> > a big profit, 20plat a tunic is a huge profit, anything above 20plat is
a
> > rip off.
> > >
> > > > As for the fixed prices, I'm all for it. I haven't reached the
level
> > where
> > > > I can make banded yet, but when I get there, I want more than a few
> > gold
> > > > profit for my wares. I do have a further suggestion though. When
you
> > see
> > > > people selling at a few gold above cost, bargain with them to get
> > their
